meanings.sent1: She kept misassigning the tasks to the wrong team members.
meanings.sent2: The teacher realized she was misassigning grades due to a mix-up in the grading system.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept misassigning the colors to the wrong shapes, creating a funny-looking picture.
meanings.sent4: His habit of misassigning blame to others made him unpopular among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The detective's misassigning of the suspect's identity led to a thrilling plot twist.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The misassigning of duties caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: She discovered the misassigning of roles in the play just before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The misassigning of seats at the event resulted in unexpected friendships forming.
meanings.sent4: The misassigning of labels on the boxes led to chaos in the warehouse.
meanings.sent5: The misassigning of tasks in the project caused delays and frustration among the team.
